Posts.Content: On Sep 15, 2008 12:00 AM spottiedottie wrote: I am 10 years out and have discovered little hard lumps on my scar near my underarm.  Has anyone else experienced this? thanks Linda I had a small breast ca and lumpectomy 10 years ago and then 4 years ago started developing 25 cent size hard lumps that hurt if i turned in my sleep and my nipple inverted, i had MRI, CT, mamo, all said no cancer; but since  since i had had 3 ca in other breast and mastec and axil dissec 14 years ago I elected to have this  lumpy breast removed now.  It greatly concerned me. How does one know under these circumstances how well the loped off breast is really looked at? Section A and Section B on the 1/2 page report said no cancer.  I would have preferred about 20-30 sections to be taken; however, too late.  I am sure they will turn this around and say I over worry etc.   The breast is gone, I do not trust the  path report of 2 areas; at least nothing jumped out and I am happy.  An inverted nipple alone gave me room for pause.  At last have MRI, CT, maybe bx of lumps and who knows? follow up again for sizing - if they grow you are in deep mess-follow the size.   Good luck
Posts.Title: mastectomy scar lumps

Posts.Content: There is a world of information on BC and you just have to look everywhere for yourself. breastcancer.org is very good and to read thru these cancer compass different comments on bc you will glean much information. Look up food inducers to arimidex, as inducers would prevent the arimidex from absorbing in your body at all thus you would receive no benefit period. I saw a list in breastcancer.org of Herbs with estrogenic effect I was rather surprised: (one does not want to ingest more hormones which you have just tested positive to ER&P+bc), flaxseed, dong quai, red clover, black cohost, ginkgo biloba, licorice root, reservertrol, rasberry leaf, red yeast extract, siberian ginsent, alfalfa, milk thistle, soy isoflavone, wild yam. You have to be very careful of taking vitamin and herb supplements as they may be counterproductive and I have found most times the people selling them really do not know the relationship to ER&P+ receptor bc. I just learned 3 days ago not to take vit & herb supplements with water as they do not metabolize, you have to have some fat or oil substance to promote metabolism - there are so many helpful hints for one to help themselves. All this hype on green tea-the original green tea from china was pure, but the mass produced high volume we get contains massive DDT enough so that it can be measured in a person's body--so I read. Read, and think thru the garbage, its your life.
Posts.Title: New Member

Posts.Content: I have had 5 cancers - 1 lung cancer - they say I am cured it was 1998, then 1 left breast ca EPR+ no node had lump; then 2 in right breast and one positive lymph node in right. I keep reading here in Cancer Compass people refer to tumor markers and CA 125, never once have these two words been mentioned to me. Is CA 125 a test for cancer? Why would no one recommend I ever have one, can you tell me why. Are tumor markers measurements where not all the tumor has been removed? Please answer my question, as I keep wondering what is going on.
Posts.Title: Looking For The Best Doctor For Stage 4 Met to Liver, Tumor Markers??....

Posts.Content: I had lumpectomy in 2004 for small 1/2" and only had radiation and arimidex, i regret radiation as it prevented me from getting reconstruction and caused controversy when I wanted to have mastectomy in 2010 as 2 drs said "I might not heal", I went to 3rd she did it at my request= I did not have cancer but had some other issues not related and she wound up saying she wished she had not done the surgery. She acted like she was annoyed  I did not have cancer- I had 3 lumps in breast that hurt but did not show up as cancer.  Radiation can throw a monkey wrench into picture if you want reconstruction up the line. Arimidex did not do the job for me. Also, go under REPEATED CELLULITIS to see what radiation can do to you. Just get the mastectomies over with and done. In 2004 had another "small lump" ER+P+ that turned out to be 2.5cm and one + node, they got clear margins and said they could take care of node with "radiation" after they sent me home.  I felt this was enough cancer for me.  I pushed for a MRI of the body at that point  because if there was any more cancer I wanted to know about it, they acted like I was over reacting-there was none.   Then I said I wanted (2 week after my 2004 surg) a mastectomy and axillary dissection and they levitated on that one as they said "they got it all".  They said it was not necessary. I stood my ground.  They did it---When I awoke from this "unnecessary surgery" --I knew something was wrong from the looks on their faces- they found more cancer in my breast at another place that did not show up on mamograms, MRI, or CT.  They had a meeting and put all my mamo, mri, CT on the wall and even knowing where this "NEW" cancer was --it still did not show up, it certainly was not their fault- it was my kind of tissue. They did still find only one positive node, and yes I have some difficulty with that  axillary dissection but I do not regret one bit my decision.  Something inside me told me enough is enough, this party has to end here.   I use to model and was always the bride and always wore the "sweatheart of the mink farm" altho today I am vehemently against harming animals-that is a long time ago. I do not regret my decision in 2010, in electing to have a mastectomy in a breast with previous breast cancer and had 3 lumps that hurt.  I was not psychic and did not know what was there, I knew what had happened in the other breast tho.  I was shocked at the Dr. who seemed angry at me because I did not have breast cancer.  My identity is not defined by the presence or absence of the breasts and yes, I do not have a male friend and my identity is not defined by the presence or absence of a male friend. From some of what I see around me, I could be blessed tho. God has always put in my path what he wanted me to have. Since 1974 I have walked alone and raised 2 girls alone , penniless -now paying interest only on my house due to all these medical expenses  and  had to have partial assisted living at home under my primary care's recommendation as I could not pick up a grocery bag or carry out a garbage bag for months or sweep, as I needed help and as a result am now ready to lose house. All my surgeries were in area on top of each other, could not use arms for months.  Had cellulitis as I was allergic to drugs given after surgery and did not realize it and scratched. I have to step back and see what God wants me to do tomorrow.  I know making the decision to have bilateral mastectomies kept me here for today. Get rid of your breasts before it is too late, sooner or later once it is in one breast it will go to the other most of the time. I don't always think Drs. are up front and straight.  I sleep so well at night.
Posts.Title: Bi-lateral Masectomy

Posts.Content: I had lumpectomy in 2004 for small 1/2" and only had radiation and arimidex, i regret radiation as it prevented me from getting reconstruction and caused controversy when I wanted to have mastectomy in 2010 as 2 drs said "I might not heal", I went to 3rd she did it at my request= I did not have cancer but had some other issues not related and she wound up saying she wished she had not done the surgery. Posts.Title: Bi-lateral Masectomy

Posts.Content: grapeseed promotes cancer (resveratol) be careful.
Posts.Title: estrogen receptor positive breast cancer..

Posts.Content: On 9/16/2009 heythere wrote: One minute of radiation in the operating room (OR) could save the lives of thousands of women being treated for breast cancer in the US today. According to a growing body of research, a 60-second course of radiation therapy delivered during surgery dramatically improves results. But, until recently, logistical and administrative difficulties prevented most patients from receiving this crucial treatment until weeks after their procedures. Now, a portable, self-contained radiation therapy system, the Mobetron from IntraOp Medical Corporation (OTCBB: IOPM; Sunnyvale, Calif.), is changing all that. St. Joseph Hospital (Orange, Calif.), one of only 16 prestigious designated National Cancer Institute Community Cancer Centers, this month introduced the first ongoing intraoperative electron radiation therapy (IOERT) program for breast cancer. During lumpectomy surgery, St. Joseph's patients receive a high dose of therapy focused specifically on the tumor site, known as a "boost." Given the benefits, other facilities are expected to follow suit. Felix Sedlmayer, MD, one of the world's leading IOERT researchers and the principal investigator of IOERT boost trials conducted by six European medical centers over the past decade, concluded that IOERT cut breast cancer five year recurrence rates dramatically, from an average of 5% to less than 1%. I would also like to know where the other machines are located.  I have often thought something like this would have been invaluable when I had my two breast cancers  (one in each  breast) and perhaps I would have not  had to choose an elective mastectomy in each breast so I could sleep well at night.
Posts.Title: Groundbreaking Breast Cancer Radiation Technique Delivers Proven Long-Term Benefits and Saves Lives

Posts.Content: I had a very small left breast ca 2/02 and was put on arimidex and like you I had absolutely NO SIDE EFFECTS AT ALL AND I BRAGGED LIKE A FOOL. I also had Dr. say not everyone has side effects and I LISTENED LIKE A FOOL. On 2/04 I found I had a right breast cancer and it had gone into my lymph node as I was totally resistant to the arimidex (a high percentage of women do not respond AT ALL IN ANY WAY TO ARIMIDEX AND THEY DO NOT TELL YOU THIS, THEY SIT BACK AND WAIT FOR YOU TO GET CANCER AGAIN). Since they sat back and let me get cancer the second time, on my own I sought out, found, paid for DNA p-450 cytochrome enzyme assay from the company Genelex ($800.) had 1A2, 2D6, 2C9,2C19 and found out I was hyperinductive to 1A2 which metabolizes Arimidex and in my case this said the Arimidex went thru my body so fast it did not stay around long enough to do me any good, and then this explain why the Arimidex failed me. How I wish I had been told this info at the beginning when I started Arimidex and I could have avoided the second cancer and the lymph node cancer - I am sick about it - There is another company now I find out that does even more studies - Genaissance in Morrisville NC and they also do 3A4 which is the enzyme which exclusively metabolizes exemestane (AROMASIN). My insurance did not pay, but it was worth every penny out of my pocket. The oncologist I see have nothing to do with DNA or gene or enzyme assays, so all this I had to do on my own - they told me I was ahead of my time - I feel they are behind the time because these tools are available now and patients should be afforded these cancer tests. Your note rang so many cords of my story, I had to respond - the main thing was your Dr. saying not all patients have side effects - I was told that and then I really got worse cancer - in the lymph node. Do not be passive and sit back and wait for more cancer. Help yourself and think for yourself. How I regret listening to the Dr. Your common sense is telling you something. Get tested for 1A2 and 3A4 at least now; if your dr. will not help you (mine would not - did not offer at all acted very threatened said there was no test available to help me) if your dr. will not help - help yourself - call Genaissance, get your primary care physician involved to draw the blood, then get rid of your oncologist - they are too narrow and ignorant. Sorry to be the one to tell you this - from one who has walked the walk...too late.
Posts.Title: Has Anybody Taken Arimidex?

Posts.Content: sue,  what do you mean your age does not matter?  I wanted a DIEP and was just turned down by a plastic surgeon because he said  I was "too old", I feel fine.   I am 70, he said he does not do DIEP on 70 year old.   Has anyone heard of a 70 year old having a DIEP?
Posts.Title: Fat necrosis after breast reconstruction

Posts.Content: I have had cancer 5 times since 7/1998; at this point I do not ask questions. 7/98 lung cancer and I am cured of that at this time, no chemo or radiation, just surgery. Then 2/02 small left breast ca; then 2/04 right breast ca, then they went back in to do lymph node resections and found another DCIS on right side at another area that did not show up on CT or MRI with dye from the week before. I had one positive lymph node on 2/04. Thus, a total of =5. It shook me up that mamo, CT and MRI with dye did not show the DCIS on the right. Due to all this, I am now going to go back and have a left mastectomy performed for safety sake. Arimidex totally failed to do the job - it was given to me 2/02 and I was resistant to it. I am now on Aromasin and I pray it is working. I think it is unethical that these anticancer medications do not work for everyone and they know that, but there is no TEST they can give to see whether the anticancer medication is working or not. We have to just sit back and wait and see if we get cancer or not. I think this is wrong.
Posts.Title: Stageiv/thirdtimer Success Story

Posts.Content: On 2/1/2009 Gentile wrote:   On 1/31/2009 janzaz wrote: I am having a masectomy on Tuesday and feel like I am living in a nightmare. All the information that is given to you doesn't go in and everytime I think about it I just want to run away. I just feel in shock. Too bad you just didnt go ahead and do both, you will probably regret it.  I had lumpectomy on right, they sent me home with clear margins then told me i had one lymph node and I decided to go back and get mastectomy and axillary dissection- they did not want to do it- said they "could get it all with radiation"---I said that is fine-i still want matec + axillary dissection.  I sleep so well at night and I have never regretted that decision- I am happy I had that mastectomy- when they went in they found another cancer at a place they had no idea there was one--it did not show up on MRI, CT or MAMO from 2 weeks earlier.  God was with me in that decision.             Also, I had had a small bc on left, around 1/2" in 2002, they did lumpectomy and I had radiation, I went last week to try to get mastectomy and the PS refused to do it- he said people who have radiation dont heal so well and they get infections.   I am sick over it.   All my intuation tells me I will wind up with another cancer.  He said i will have to wait until I get cancer to have a mastectomy, I was so surprised.  Nothing is worth getting more cancer, nothing. On this left side I have inverted nipple, lumps in left side that hurt and I already know my skin type does ot show cancer.    Be happy you can get rid of the cancer and that they found it while there is still time......thank them...you were spared.....think about getting rid of the other breast  while you can.    If it shows tubular cancer in the pathology report, it always comes back on the other side so read pathology report (someone told me).   GOOD LUCK...     I had a masectomy in July of 2007.  It is frightening but sometimes what we see in our mind is worse then the reality.  Once the surgery is over you will probably have a drain (for me that was hard because I had to deal with it on me own).  Take your time to accept the change to your body, it took me some time to really look at my scar.  The fear will lessen, the reminder is there but you accept it a little more each day.  When you go for an appointment take a friend who will be your ears, you can never take it all in.  You will stronger then you ever thought you could be.
Posts.Title: Masectomy

Posts.Content: I had left bc & lumpectomy 2002 + radiation, now inverted nipple; my tissue is such that cancer does not show up on MRI, CT and mamograms.  My breast hurts and is lumpy.   I have had 5 cancers, one of which was lung cancer in 1998.   I  wanted to have a mastectomy on left breast and  dr refused to do it as he said radiated tissue does not heal and he personally did not want to take chance and I should wait to get  cancer. I cant take any more cancer or chemo, the chemo almost killed me, I stayed in bed 21 days with treatments, could not get out of bed so weak. Is there any treatment that would help oxygenate my tissue presurgery, i.e. hyperbaric treatment for a few months before surgery to help me, I simply have to have this elective mastectomy before it is too late.  I have never had metastasis..   I was stunned for him to say that.   What can I do to help myself rather than stay home and wait to die? I was cured of lung cancer.I feel well, really well.   I am 70.
Posts.Title: ?Would hyperbaria help riadiated tissue from bc so I can have a mastectomy.

Posts.Content: On Mar 11, 2011 3:07 AM REDVETTE wrote: My husband chokes and strangles on EVERYTHING that is swallowed including his own saliva.   All of his Drs., Dentists, Oral Surgeon, Swallow Therapist (the list goes on) - understand this.   Surely you can explain this to your dentist - if they don't understand the damage then you need a dentist/oral surgeon who is very well versed in radiation damage.   Good luck and God Bless You! redvette has he had any lower dental work? how could he have it that required shots and did not paralyze his throat and they would be able to go ahead with dental procedure with him unable to swallow?  Did they give him IV shot to put him asleep?a or take him to OR under anesthesia with a tube down his throat?  Please tell me ASAP, I need to know;  I have root canal gone bad on one side it hurts so badly and other side a wisdom tooth that needs to come out all at bottom.  I am truly fearful as i know all it takes is one drop from a needle down my throat and I loose all control of my throat muscle.   Absoutely no nerve block. Has anyone else had this problem.  I cannot be the only bc woman given  radiation at the clavicle.?? Thanks so much. Understand is fine but how do they circumvent him choking to death?
Posts.Title: Inside throat very small since radiation to clavicle post bc

Posts.Content: On Aug 19, 2010 6:21 PM roymmgsm wrote: Brief Case Details   A.     Patient Age: 76 years; maintains reasonably good health. Diabetic/ hypertensive. Other vitals of heart, liver etc ok B.     Carcinoma of Breast (Left) Modified Radical Mastectomy (MRM) completed on 29.07.2010 C.     Histo Biopsy Large (others) Tumor size 4 X 3 Cms with infiltrative margins Auxillary lymphnodes number 15, largest measuring 1.8 cms, belongs to level I Level I – 13 lymph nodes – All free (0/13) Level II – 2 lymph nodes – All free (0/2) DCIS – absent ; Lymphatic/ Vascular Emboli – present ; Stromal desmoplasia - present Opinion: Infiltrating Duct Carcinoma (NOS), Grade 3, Score 8, left breast (pT2N0) D.    Histo Biopsy MRM / BCS with Tissue Immunohistochemistry IHC marker                                  Allred Score               Interpretation Estrogen Receptor (ER)                           0/8                           Negative Progestrone Receptor (PR)          0/8                           Negative Her-2-Neu-1757/10 (S-7586/10) Marker                                         Score                           Result Her-2-neu (c-erb B2)                     3+                                Positive   Repeat Test ER/ PR repeat test from Ranbaxy laboratory in Mumbai: ER/PR not detected Her-2-neu repeat test by FISH method indicates no amplification of the HER-2/neu gene   Why wouldn't you want to give her chemo, as long as she can tolerate it?  Some people do not have as much difficulty as others.   Did they get clear margins?   Did they do mastectomy and  axillary resection with removal of all axillary lymph nodes; I was not clear reading report?   I made myself tolerate chemo inspite of fact  I thought I would have to crawl to kitchem to get glass of water.  I wanted to live another day when it was all over. I have had one  lung cancer and 4 breast cancers and still here; I would take anything they wanted to give me.  I took arimidex and it was worthless; now take aromasin and think it is wonderful. Had elective two mastectomy and thankful I did, no recon.  I had terrible time with my mouth during chemo- simply horrible, nothing worked. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Should chemo be given after MRM in 76 year old lady patient

Posts.Content: I know a company has FDA approval 12/07 to use stem cells for breast restoration after lumpectomy for the recessed area - do not know which US drs will do this - does anyone know any US drs or very good drs abroad who can replace a mastectomy area with stem cells?  I am sure this is being done abroad>   anyone with info?
Posts.Title: breast restoration post mastectomy using stem cells-? who in US does this

Posts.Content: On 7/3/2008 pinkribbonmar wrote: Hi there, Just wanted to respond to your message.  I had bilateral mastectomies a few years ago and opted, like you, for the flat look.  I only recently got fitted for breast prostheses, to wear in my sister's wedding, but rarely wear them in my daily life.  I have found that I have become increasingly comfortable with the flat look. At first I was always aware/self-conscious about it but eventually just got used to it and often forget about it completely, which is freeing!  I love not dealing with bras, and I wear any shirt/top that I feel good in.  I started off always wearing baggy shirts, but now will wear tanks, summer shirts, bathing suits, anything!    I wish you all the best! You are a strong woman!  Take care. Pinkribbonmar.This subject is so timely as I am pondering my second  elective mastectomy and trying to decide with or without restoration as I am getting as hassle from plastic surgeons as I had  radiation in the past in this breast I now want a mastectomy.  How do you "flat" ladies feel your  interrelationships with men are and are any of you single?  If any of you are married, is this awkward?  I hate to be personal but I would really like to know as I know no one personally to ask this question.  I apologize asking it here.   This is a huge step to take.   I have been wearing a form for the other breast, but with two breast either gone or trying a little harder to have the second one done with a restoration of some sort (I cannot have a implant).  I went to try to have the mastectomy side/axillary dissection side/radiation side have a restoration and PS refused as I had had  radiation.   I do not know what they will say about the other side that has a breast remaining but had had BC in past but only had lumpectomy and radiation---if that radiation will still rule me out from having a restoration still again.   DOES ANYONE KNOW??   I WOULD LIKE TO KNOW????
Posts.Title: The flat look

Posts.Content: I choke sometimes on my own saliva and if i go to dentist and one drop of the dental anesthesia from the needle happens to go down my throat i lose all ability to swallow or to control my muscles in my throat and feel like i am going to choke to death.  Now I need to have two teeth pulled at the bottom and I fear how I am going to have them pulled out as I know no one can give me a show at the bottom as I could choke to death.  Of course, I can use that wand and catch all my own saliva(every drop) until feeling comes back, but i dont think dentist realizes how bad this problem is and I am not being a hysteric. I cant help this,  I lose all control over use of my throat muscles.   What can I do? I had 4 breast cancers and the last one in 2004 they gave me lots of radiation to my clavicle, for a while i regurgitated food but that has stopped.
Posts.Title: Inside throat very small since radiation to clavicle post bc

Posts.Content: On Mar 10, 2011 10:19 PM Resourceful wrote: I choke sometimes on my own saliva and if i go to dentist and one drop of the dental anesthesia from the needle happens to go down my throat i lose all ability to swallow or to control my muscles in my throat and feel like i am going to choke to death.  Now I need to have two teeth pulled at the bottom and I fear how I am going to have them pulled out as I know no one can give me a show at the bottom as I could choke to death.  Of course, I can use that wand and catch all my own saliva(every drop) until feeling comes back, but i dont think dentist realizes how bad this problem is and I am not being a hysteric. I cant help this,  I lose all control over use of my throat muscles.   What can I do? I had 4 breast cancers and the last one in 2004 they gave me lots of radiation to my clavicle, for a while i regurgitated food but that has stopped. i mistyped above, above i said i fear how i am going to have them pulled out as I know no one can give me a SHOW  at the bottom   I should have said   ...I how no can give me a SHOT .... AT THE BOTTOM excuse my haste
Posts.Title: Inside throat very small since radiation to clavicle post bc

Posts.Content: I live by myself and it would take elaborate home care logistical arrangements after surgery etc and I am concerned about getting my hopes up too high if I am being unrealistic ab out being a candidate in the first place. I would have to leave the state and probably go to Baltimore alone (this alone makes me skeptical). My questions for the surgery revolve around: on my left side I had lumpectomy and radiation 3 years ago; however 2 years ago I had right mastectomy and complete axillary dissection (26 nodes - although only one node positive). the node was nonproliferating, noninvasive, the ca was 2.5 cm with all margins clear. I then had radiation. Having had radiation on both sides and an axillary dissection on one side, are patients ever accepted as being eligible for DIEP. I am sure if it was recommended to first get hyperbaric chamber I could get this. What is the likelihood the DIEP would be successful?
Posts.Title: Eligibility & Prerequisites For Diep

Posts.Content: Did you have DIEP immediately during mastectomy or did you have it sometime later and also did you have axillary dissection? Have you had lymphedema? I have been warned that a lot of women get in big trouble with lymphedema if they have had axillary dissection and then go and havea the DIEP. Is this true. I want to have all the info I need to make an intelligent decision on this one. What do you mean necrosis? I know what necrosis means, how would this relate to DIEP much later after mastectomy and on my left side I want to have a mastectomy with the DIEP at the same time. I wish so much they would do just one side at a time, but again I am told they only want to do both sides at the same time.
Posts.Title: Eligibility & Prerequisites For Diep

Posts.Content: by the way thanks millions for indepth info. I only had axil resect on right, not on left. Again reading between lines you did have help i.e. someone with you and you did not have to "hoof" it alone, there is a big difference. Also, I would think there would be a big difference between how many and how long drains would be in a woman with and without axil dissection, because a women with a prior axil dissection and to undergo any surgery on that side could be quite problematic. They tell me to not even have my blood pressure taken on that side or even blood. I have to assume there would be more drains and more time in hospital due to no lymph drainage/axillary dissection. Next set of questions: what info did you take up there for your initial/screening visit? copies of all mamos, ct's, mri's, surgical notes, path notes on all slides taken during surgery, or even the slides and/or blocks of tissue themselves. Of courese you came from CA and you may have had one straight shot, I will certainly have two and want two as I want to come back and ponder choices and make arrangements if I am eligible. You may have assumed you were eligible, I do not. I am also overweight and this would be the best incentive in the world for me to be accepted under the condition I lose xxx lbs before the surgery, which would be quite realistic. I am 48 lbs overweight and am uninspired to do anything about it as it is so awkward to be so asymmetrical, I have to do something to be the same on both sides. A bra rides up on one side no matter what and hurts because there is nothing to hold it from riding up -- even with mas form. However, I am alive despite all the odds and I feel vain to even consider this surgery. I do not want to put vainness in front of common sense. Thank you so many billions for info, you and I are at much different places but then share some fragments of sameness. Thanks again.
Posts.Title: Eligibility & Prerequisites For Diep

Posts.Content: Thanks for response.Did you also have axillary resection? How long were you in hospital and how long did you have to stay in area/Baltimore before you could leave to go home? Did you have someone with you or could you have done it alone? Did you also have dead/necrotic areas develop after surgery? where did you stay after the hospitalization if you stayed on in Baltimore for a few days? Since you were from out of town was there someone there at JH you could turn to for general info (closest bank,motel, taxi info etc). The disadvantage with medical centers is that often they lose their "humanness" and personal touch and no one knows anything about nothing after you leave the medical/surgical level of operation. You are passed on to a brick wall and if you are alone you simply cannot deal with it right after surgery. How long ago was your B recon? Thanks for info.
Posts.Title: Eligibility & Prerequisites For Diep

Posts.Content: I have to read between the lines when I read your note to apply it to my circumstance. You say you had rad to one breast and you had 3 areas of necrosis when you later had the DIEP, so what you are saying is that rad does have influence on DIEP. I have had rad on both breasts at one time or another, one has not had a mastectomy but the other has. Altho when I read between the lines you said you had aggressive ca and poor margins, so I expect they zapped the rad to you. I had clear margin on the right but I requested the mastectomy and also the axillary dissection as no one was psychic and could tell me how many lymph nodes were involved without taking them out (all 26), only one was positive and they said it was beautiful pink healthy looking and if they had to bet they would have bet it was not ca. Altho, as I said I requested a mastectomy and when they did it they found a "trick or treat" cancer they were not aware of at an entirely differnet place that had not shown in mamo or the CT or MRI from the week before, small, and DCIS. I do not know, but I suspect they zapped me with the rad as I know they were rad up to my clavicle etc. My "trick or treat" gave them a pause for concern and it is for this reason I want to electively have a left mastectomy before it is too late. I can't help but wonder tho realistically if a woman has had 4 cancers at one place or another in both her breasts if it is not too late. I am told I have not had metastatic. Could you have managed alone the bilateral DIEP surgery, left the hospital and traveled 400 miles back home alone on a plane or train? I don't want to pass out in some airport.
Posts.Title: Eligibility & Prerequisites For Diep

Posts.Content: I had lumpectomy and radiation 2002 on left to very small bc, has anyone had reconstruction  after radiation to breast.  I was refused reconstruction to right breast where i had radiation  to mastectomy area in 2004.  I want to have a mastectomy on left before bc returns but would like to elect a reconstruction at time of mastectomy; however, have had prior radiation to that area and wonder if they will now refuse . I do not know what is standard for reconstruction and it seems all you ladies say you had chemo but i do not see you had radiation.   Please let me know.  I was told after radiation tissue dead and skin will not take, any comments?????
Posts.Title: Anyone Radiation and then Reconstruction?

Posts.Content: I had mastectomy 1/29 and it was beautiful, mastectomy was over a prior cancer (02) that was radiated. I had a household accident that forced me to use my arms 6 weeks later (i live alone) and then I developed swelling that looked like I "grew a breast in mastectomy site). They withdrew fluid x2 but it came back;then they put a drain in for a month; when all fluid and blood drained it left me with very disfiguring pucker over mastectomy site.  I am  told since this is over the prior radiated site (i.e. tissue) nothing can be done-altho my original healing (2010)was absolutely  astonishingly beautiful  and I feel it was the emergency accident I was forced into dealing with that precipitated the  swelling  and would have happened to anyone.  In one week I had a heal that looked like a 6 month old heal from surgery; I am heart broken to see this disfigurement.   I am 72 however still do not want this.   Does anyone know  what kind of procedure is used to take  care of  something like this and  of a place that has taken care of this type problem often? My skin is in excellent condition- have always used olive oil.
Posts.Title: Marked puckering over radiated mastectomy site

Posts.Content: you said they looked at 2 lymph nodes, one was positive and they did axillary dissection. That means they took ALL your lymph nodes then, there could be 18-25 more and they will examine them, you probably have been notified by now if more have cancer which they could/or could not. I had the same deal and I elected to go back later (3 weeks) and have a mastectomy on right and now want to go back and have elective on left. To me with even one positive lymph node is time to do mastectomy of ALL breast tissue on both sides and put all narcissism aside. They told me they could take care of that one positive node with chemo and rad, but I wanted axill dissect and mas - it was time. When they did the elective mast 3 weeks later they found another cancer at another place in that breast they were not aware of and MRI nor CT scan had not revealed and I had just had the MRI and CT 1 1/2 weeks prior to the surgery. Things get real serious when you get one lymph node and drs do not have psychic eyes, one must have common sense for themselves and also think for themselves. One node is one big message, listen to it- time to buck up.
Posts.Title: New-just Had Lumpectomy-lymph Node Question

Posts.Content: On 8/2/2009 candy4057783 wrote:   On 2/10/2009 Resourceful wrote:   On 2/5/2009 neetco wrote: Hi,   I had Arimidex followed by Aromasin for a total of 21/2yrs. The wk I went on Arimidex I started radiation, so when my arms began having shooting pins and needles, like electricity running from the hands up I questioned it but both oncol and radiol drs said it couldn't be either of their therapies. Long story short, hands got worse and I had carpel tunnel surgery on the right hand.  Switching to Aromosin i thought there was slight improvement but eventually (6M0s later) realized it was worsening again. Oncol Doc switched me to Tamoxefin and I have almost recovered. The hand that had surgery is still painful in the AM but only upon wakening.  I would be careful about taking an aromatase inhibitor. My Doc will never give it to me again.  Wishing you luck,  Carole I think I would be a little careful about choosing sides.  Aromasin is about the best most comprehensive medications there is anticancer  long term.  I for one  would rather get on my knees and thank God there is medication so I do not have cancer and bear a little discomfort.   Women become resistent to Tamoxifen and indeed begin being estrogen positive on it, read the literature.....not so on Aromasin.  Do your research for yourself IN DEPTH.......The effects from Aromasin are permanent, not so for Tamoxifin.  Good luck. If I could GET on my knees without moaning and groaning and asking for help to get up I WOULD thank God for the drug. I understand what you are saying but for some of us the struggle to deal with the pain e v e r y  single day sometimes gets overwhelming.Looking backing my comment of 2/10/2009 really had two variables and that was unfortunate- you began radiation & aromatase inhibitor at same time.  For what it it worth I want to mention my experience- you know people always like to shift the BLAME.....I was on NO MEDICATION. I began radiation and on the 3rd radiation treatment my arm swelled like a huge baseball bat, dead as a doorbell, I could not even lift it, it was normal before the treatment.  The radiation drs said to me it dit not come from the radiation- of course it did --- I have had horrible problems with lymphedema since that day with swelling up to my clavicle.  Of course it came from the radiation.   They said radiation does not cause a problem so soon,  well it did with me, I am very sensitive; also a very very allergic person- it did cause a problem with me on the 3rd treatment and I wound up having up lymphedema treatments to the arm.  I am throwing this out there.
Posts.Title: I never put the 2 together

Posts.Content: Also saw your messages on the Arimidex questions. I had absolutely no side effects from Arimidex and also had absolutely no gain and got more cancer two years later, then they put me on Aromasin. Again, now I have absoltuely no side effects from Aromasin and I am concerned. Aromasin is different than the other 2 aromatase inhibitors and it is also steroidal and supposedly does not affect bones like other 2 (so they say ???). There is a clinical trial soon to be over called CAT and they are giving Toremifene (sister of tamoxifine) and Atamestane (second generation Aromasin-this one is experimental now not on market), the toremifene is on market)- they are giving both at the same time to get the estrogen from both sides and consider if MORE effective in preventing cancer - This is the DOUBLE HORMONE TRIAL - I think the drugs are quite efficient - HOLD ON ----HELP may be on the way. People who have side effects need to get on their knees and thank GOD, the medicine is working.. 42% of women it is totally ineffective and they move on and get more cancer. Think of your choices. I do think tho Aromasin is not as hard on bones as rest. I am holding my breath as I think HELP IS ON THE WAY.
Posts.Title: Has Anyone Been on Aromasin and Are They Getting Side Effects?

Posts.Content: I took arimidex in 2002 and it totally failed me, as 2 years later I developed cancer in other breast. Now after chem and radiation they put me on Aromasin but I have absolutely no side effects of any kind (the same as it was when I took the Arimidex), I am very worried, as I do not want to find out 2 year s from now the Aromasin did not work and I have more cancer as I did this time with the Arimidex. Does anyone know of an indicating test that would give some idea if the Aromasin is working. I understand these drugs only work in 52% of the patients. No one gave me the cold hard facts when they gave me the medicine, and no one gives me a test to tell me if I am in the 52% or the 48%. My life depends on where I stand taking this medicine. Any ideas of a test??????
Posts.Title: is There a Test to See of Aromasin is Working?

Posts.Content: On 2/5/2009 neetco wrote: Hi,   I had Arimidex followed by Aromasin for a total of 21/2yrs. The wk I went on Arimidex I started radiation, so when my arms began having shooting pins and needles, like electricity running from the hands up I questioned it but both oncol and radiol drs said it couldn't be either of their therapies. Long story short, hands got worse and I had carpel tunnel surgery on the right hand.  Switching to Aromosin i thought there was slight improvement but eventually (6M0s later) realized it was worsening again. Oncol Doc switched me to Tamoxefin and I have almost recovered. The hand that had surgery is still painful in the AM but only upon wakening.  I would be careful about taking an aromatase inhibitor. My Doc will never give it to me again.  Wishing you luck,  Carole I think I would be a little careful about choosing sides.  Aromasin is about the best most comprehensive medications there is anticancer  long term.  I for one  would rather get on my knees and thank God there is medication so I do not have cancer and bear a little discomfort.   Women become resistent to Tamoxifen and indeed begin being estrogen positive on it, read the literature.....not so on Aromasin.  Do your research for yourself IN DEPTH.......The effects from Aromasin are permanent, not so for Tamoxifin.  Good luck.
Posts.Title: I never put the 2 together

Posts.Content: I had small left lump breast removed 2/2002, no nodes, lumpectomy, 1 cm, then put on arimidex; 90% estrogen + Progesterone positive. On 2/2004 they saw another small lump right breast but said since I had been on arimidex for 2 years it must be "the other kind of cancer but do not worry", I had lumpectomy - they did not check the one sentinel node during surgery as it looked "so pink and healthy" sent me home. Four days later called me said I had positive sentinel node, do not worry they could take care of it with chemo and radiation. The "lump" was 100% estrogen + progesterone positive ---not the other kind. you figure it out - the arimidex was worthless I took for 2 years. I demanded total body CT and MRI because if there was more cancer I wanted to know as I also demanded in 2 weeks to return and have axillary dissection and a complete mastectomy. They said CT and MRI (with dye both of them) were negataive - mind you both 1 1/2 weeks before my second surgery. They did not want to do this second surgery but something told me things were not right. I did have my axillary dissection and when they did my mastectomy at the same time (this was 2 weeks after the CT and MRI which was suppose to be negative) they found more cancer at a totally different place unrelated to the original lump I went in for. I know, and I am also told, some women's normal tissue is such that it does not differentiate between normal and early cancer and so for this reason I am going to elect to backtrack and have my left breast removed because if a CT scan and MRI fail to show cancer and arimidex does not deter me getting cancer - I think I am in deep water. I have now completed chemo and radiation (very horrible experience) and they just put me on Aromasin but I question if it is working as I have absolutely no feelings of any effects from it --the same as the Arimidex --I felt absolutely nothing - no hot flashes, no hunger, total no sensation 24/7. I am very concerned I am resistent to the Aromasin also and want to be P450 cytochrome pharmacogenetic enzyme tested but cannot find a place to test me to Aromasin. I paid to have myself tested for the Arimidex and found out I was hyperinductive to 1A2 pathway and the enzyme was passing thru me so fast metabolically that the arimidex did not hang around long enough to do any good. Now I understand about the Arimidex. The Aromasin is a totally different enzyme pathway 3A4, but I have been unable to find even a research/experimental university affiliated place I can go to for a consult for my genetic makeup for handling of the 3A4. Can anyone out there help me??????
Posts.Title: CT Scans - Necessary or Not

Posts.Content: On Oct 21, 2008 12:00 AM Delia_Margaret wrote: I was operated on four years ago today for breast cancer.  After serious infections, chemo and radiation and a "flap" operation to close up open the wound after 18 months of daily dressing, I seemed on the road to recovery. Yes ,Hair never did return to former luxurient growth (dammit!) and for many months there was a very painful adjustment to the Arimidex, which disappeared on changing to Aromasin.  My feet and hands are chubby and two sizes larger, but what the heck!  Aren't I alive?  Now my question is?  Does anyone know how I can avoid the recurring cellulitis I have endured since the beginning?  I have had nine different episodes each involving being on a drip in hospital for either two weeks or four weeks at a time.  In the past 12 months I have been in hospital for four and a half MONTHS pumping those dreaded anti biotics into me.  My doctors look pityingly at me and say " you are just unlucky".  I have decided NOT GOOD ENOUGH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I get it on my breasts, ribcage and back especially where there is scar tissue. There seems to be excessive radiation burn ,although I did not have any adverese effects at the time.  I can NOT plan anything in my life and would so appreciate any input, if any, from out there.   Kindest regards, Delia it seems once you have cellulitis you are vulnerable and certain motions bring it on again (like motions one would use when blowing leaves in a yard or "swifting").   These are the muscles I guess were cut into at surgery and then damaged by the cellulitis; I wore a chest tube hanging out of me for 6 weeks  with blood constantly clogging up the tubes.  Mine began because I was given clindamycin and I was allergic to it and I scratched myself after mastectomy constantly and I developed cellulitis and also "grew a breast" where my mastectomy was - a big blue one that had to have blood released and it came right back.  I also went to hospital for the antibiotics again with the cellulitis and it seems to this day anything I do triggers this area and the other side also where I had also had a mastectomy and axillary dissection - my entire chest area.  Once the fluid and cellulitis went away I now look like I have been skined to the bone, all over my chest area, there is no meat. I did not look this way before. Are you wearing anything constrictive, rubbing, or doing some sort of exercise or daily household chore that is using pulling muscle  of the chest that might be aggravating this? Could you have not gotten rid of it all (infection) to begin with? Have you had microbiology tests of the fluid to see what is growing? I really got a lot of run around and pass around and this kind of problem is a mess, and no one really knows what to do, I went from stem to stern and very very sick and really begging for help with a chest tube hanging out of me. I truly sat for 6 months too weak to move until the tube was taken out (really fell out when it got to 3 cc). You need to be using very safe antiseptic techniques at home, and wash your hands  often and scrub your fingernails; germs are coming  from somewhere.  What ages are your children.  Mine were gone. Think about irritants, or motions  conducive to irritation. Something in your environment, or on your couch,?animal. Don't wear tight bras, i just did not wear one; too much hassle.  Cellulitis is very serious.  Back step what you have been doing. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Recurring Cellulitis

Posts.Content: On Oct 21, 2008 12:00 AM Delia_Margaret wrote: I was operated on four years ago today for breast cancer.  After serious infections, chemo and radiation and a "flap" operation to close up open the wound after 18 months of daily dressing, I seemed on the road to recovery. Posts.Title: Recurring Cellulitis
